it.emarolab.scene_identification_tracking.semanticSceneLibrary.objects

Interface Semantics.Descriptor<O,I>

  • Type Parameters:
    O - the class to refer to for manipulating the semantic structure.
    I - the individual describing an Object in the ontology.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MORDescriptor
    Enclosing interface:
    Semantics

    public static interface Semantics.Descriptor<O,I>
    This interface represents the class that should be able to manage a specific semantic description ( e.g.: XML, OWL, MongoDB etc...).

    It is supposed to be available in each Semantics.Primitive derived objects through the Semantics.Primitive.getSemantics() method.
    This object is the one that can manipulate the ontology and try to synchronise the java to the semantic representation; writing process. As well as, perfroming reading processes, to synchronise the semantic with the java representation.

    In particular, this interface defines that a semantic description should container a reference to the ontology in which semantically map an object and the name of the instance that represent such an object. A good practice is to set this name as the object unique identifier (see Semantics.Primitive.getID()).

    File: it.emarolab.scene_identification_tracking.semanticSceneLibrary.objects.Semantics
